;;Donatella Versace 周日抵达意大利米兰参加 CNMI 可持续时尚奖时为摄影师摆姿势。;

;意大利的同性恋权利组织赞扬多纳泰拉·范思哲 (Donatella Versace) 在获得时尚奖时以衷心的个人演讲反对政府的反同性恋政策。

;

;“我们的政府正在努力采取行动剥夺了人们按照自己的意愿生活的权利，”范思哲在周日晚上的一次演讲中说道，特别引用了一项允许;只有同性伴侣中的亲生父母才能被正式承认为父母。 ;“他们正在限制我们的自由，”她说。

;

;“在跨性别者仍然遭受可怕暴力的时代，在同性儿童遭受暴力侵害的时代，我们都必须为自由而战。夫妻不被视为自己的孩子，在这个时代，少数群体的声音受到新法律的攻击。”范思哲 (Versace) 说道。自 1997 年弟弟詹尼·范思哲 (Gianni Versace) 被谋杀以来，她一直担任该时装公司的创意总监。

;

;演讲在斯卡拉歌剧院获得了时尚人群的起立鼓掌，范思哲在那里获得了人道主义奖。

;

;同性恋权利活动人士赞扬她明确挑战政府的行为，但呼吁整个时尚界这样做更多。

;
;

;;相关：;;“法令规定成为孤儿”：意大利同性父母对失去权利的反应;

;
;

;“Donatella Versace 是意大利第一个在面对政府的恐同政治时如此明确和明确的人，”长期同性恋权利活动家佛朗哥·格里尼尼 (Franco Grillini) 说道。 “她是时尚界最重要的人物之一，我邀请其他人以她为榜样。”

;

;除了阻止承认同性伴侣的孩子之外，总理的右翼政府，乔治亚·梅洛尼 (Giorgia Meloni) 正在推动立法，禁止在国外寻求代孕妈妈，否则将被处以监禁和严厉处罚。 2004 年的一项法律已禁止意大利境内代孕。

;

;意大利同性恋党领袖也赞扬了范思哲的支持，并呼吁她支持他们在意大利选票上就同性婚姻进行公投的活动。他们希望在一月份开始收集签名，因为他们意识到“议会多数派不想给我们权利”。意大利于 2016 年批准了同性民事结合，是最后一个这样做的西方主要国家。

;

;“多纳泰拉·范思哲 (Donatella Versace) 的宣言很重要 (...) 她明确表示本届政府正在如何削弱同性公民的自由和权利LGBTQ 群体”，同性恋党和平等婚姻公投发言人 Fabrizio Marrazzo 说道。 “我们请她支持我们，特别是让女同性恋、男同性恋和跨性别者的婚姻与其他人一样的运动。”

;

;范思哲在民主党亚历山德罗·赞 (Alessandro Zan) 的陪同下领奖。立法者起草了扩大对 LGBTQ+ 群体的反歧视保护的立法。甚至在 Meloni 政府上任之前，这项立法就陷入了停滞。

;

;在一个感人的时刻，Versace 还回忆起她哥哥 Gianni 向她出柜的那一天。

;

;“当时我 11 岁当我哥哥詹尼告诉我他是同性恋时。对我来说，这没有改变任何事情。我爱他，我不在乎他爱谁，”她告诉人群。

; Wed, 27 Sep 2023 02:52:01 +0800 Canada parliament speaker resigns after calling Ukrainian Nazi veteran a ‘hero’https://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/sep/26/anthony-rota-canada-resigns-nazi-parliament
;;2023-09-26T18:04:09Z;
;
;;周一，安东尼·罗塔在加拿大安大略省渥太华国会山。
;

;议长加拿大议会已辞职 ;加拿大众议院议长在赞扬乌克兰纳粹部队老兵后道歉;

; ;

;洪卡在旁听席上敬礼时，泽连斯基举起拳头表示感谢。

;

;但周末有消息称，洪卡曾是武装党卫队“加利西亚”师或党卫军第 14 武装师（一支受纳粹指挥的志愿部队）的成员。

;

;西蒙·维森塔尔大屠杀研究中心表示，该部门“;对大规模屠杀无辜平民负有责任;，其残忍程度和恶意程度令人难以想象。”

;

;其他著名的犹太团体很快也加入了进来对洪卡的邀请和事件的谴责很快成为加拿大政府的一个重大政治尴尬。

;

;罗塔后来表示，他“随后了解到更多信息，这让我对自己邀请这位退伍军人的决定感到后悔” ，住在罗塔选区。 “我特别想向加拿大和世界各地的犹太社区致以最深切的歉意。我对自己的行为承担全部责任。”

;

;总理办公室表示，没有事先通知洪卡将出席周五的议会会议，因为他是议长的嘉宾，而且与会者名单并未公开。

;

;在加拿大，与其他拥有威斯敏斯特式议会的国家一样，下议院议长是一个无党派的角色。议长由所有立法者选举产生，负责监督议会的职能。

;

;周一，加拿大总理贾斯汀·特鲁多称这一时刻“令;加拿大;并延伸至所有加拿大人”。但在政府众议院领导人卡琳娜·古尔德要求将罗塔从议会正式记录（包括当天的所有录音）中“删除”后，他的政党也受到了进一步的审查。

;

; /www.thestar.com/opinion/editorials/the-house-of-commons-careless-recognition-of-war-veteran/article_378d948f-de73-5355-8e92-2f3762a3a5bf.html">;对罗塔的谴责越来越多; ，社交媒体用户猜测他即将辞职。政治评论员 ;David Moscrop 发布了一张 Rota 和一棵生菜的照片;，向 ;英国前首相利兹·特拉斯最后的、陷入困境的日子;。< /p>;

;对洪卡的关注也引起了波兰的兴趣，该国教育部长表示，他已“采取措施”引渡洪卡。 “鉴于加拿大议会发生的丑闻事件，涉及在泽伦斯基总统在场的情况下表彰纳粹党卫军加利津犯罪组织的一名成员，我已采取措施，可能将这名男子引渡到波兰，”普热梅斯瓦夫·查尔内克（Przemysław Czarnek）周二在社交媒体帖子中说道。

;

;大屠杀纪念组织西蒙·维森塔尔中心之友在一份声明中表示，该活动还“将宣传胜利拱手让给了俄罗斯，分散了人们对这场具有重大意义的展示的注意力”。加拿大和乌克兰之间的团结”。

; Wed, 27 Sep 2023 02:22:01 +0800 Made-up New York restaurant goes from internet joke to one-night-only realityhttps://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2023/sep/26/mehrans-steak-house-new-york-opening
;;2023-09-26T17:45:48Z;
;
;;生肉块，牛肋骨。一位男厨师的手将盐和香料放在深色背景上。生肉块，牛肋骨。一位男厨师的手将盐和香料放在黑暗的背景上，特写。
;

;一家“假牛排馆”最初只是一群科技行业朋友之间的“精心设计的笑话”，之后在网上疯传在纽约市举行了第一次会议，有 140 人和媒体成员参加。

;

;Mehran's Steak House 此前仅以 Google 地图列表的形式存在，由 Mehran Jalali 的室友创建，一家人工智能初创公司的 21 岁创始人在周六的第一晚也是最后一晚吸引了食客。

;
;

;;相关：;;阴暗时刻：纽约街头生活 - 图片< /a>;

;
;

;Jalali 的室友们为了表彰他的牛排烹饪能力，在他们位于上东区的合租房屋中列出了这家牛排馆，并留下了好评如潮，于是“餐厅”就开始了。这导致我们坐在一个临时空间里，菜单上有一个名为“牛的生命圈”的菜单。

;

;来自;纽约时报;，;《纽约邮报》; 和《This American Life》显然都到场报道了这一事件，但网上一些人批评这一诡计是对这一事件的拙劣模仿。一家总部位于伦敦的假餐厅，早在 2017 年开业的一晚就欺骗食客吃 1 英镑的即食餐。

;

;《纽约时报》报道称，Jalali 和其他 16 人都在科技行业工作当他们中的一个在 Google 地图上创建 Mehran's Steak House 列表时，他们生活在“黑客之家”中。在一年的时间里，该列表获得了许多朋友的评论，尽管事后看来，其中一些华丽的色调可能是一种赠品。

;

;“​​我从未尝过如此美味和精致的东西。当您咬下一口时，您的整个身心都会进入纯粹的幸福和宁静之中。显然，这块牛排是上帝之手烹制的。”一位评论者说道。

;

;另一位评论者写道：“我不愿意透露更多关于这次旅行的细节，因为这是一次深刻的情感体验，我会记住我的余生。”

;

;尽管餐厅不存在，但它开始受到关注。 2022 年的一天，两个人出现在公寓里想要一张桌子。据《泰晤士报》报道，他们被拒之门外，但室友们考虑开一家餐厅，并创建了一个网站，上面有一份等候名单，吸引了 900 多名注册者。

;

;到了今年，这群人中的大多数人已经搬家了到西海岸。据《泰晤士报》报道，在一位美食作家开始调查 Mehran's Steak House 后，Jalali 决定租用活动场地并举办餐食，以保留这个笑话。

;

;“如果有更多人关注它，”Jalali告诉《泰晤士报》：“整个事情都会发生。”

;

;他们在曼哈顿东村预订了一个活动场地，联系了等候名单上的人们，周六的盛大演出就这样诞生了。< /p>;

;据《纽约邮报》报道，60 多名工作人员向食客打招呼，进行了一场“值得记住”的“微妙的猜谜游戏”。

;

;活动空间用经过修改的照片进行了模拟。贾拉利 (Jalali) 为约翰·F·肯尼迪 (John F Kennedy) 和阿尔伯特·爱因斯坦 (Albert Einstein) 等人提供食物，贾拉利 (Jalali) 告诉食客：“我建议你暂时不要理解线性时间。”

;

;菜单上有一杯牛奶 - 显然是在提到菜单的牛主题——奶酪和牛排。

;

;贾拉利和他的朋友并不是第一个让人们相信他们经营一家广受好评的餐厅的人，然而，正如一些人在《纽约时报》;关于当晚的 Instagram 帖子;。

;

;“对于那些从未听说过 The Shed 的人德威奇，我猜这些人决定要偷这部分，”一个人写道。

;

;另一位网友发帖称：“德威奇的棚屋[原文如此]会在这里采取法律行动吗？”并标记了;Oobah Butler;。

;

;那些评论者和其他人正在引用;假餐厅; – “The Shed at Dulwich”——由英国作家巴特勒于 2017 年在伦敦的家中开设。

;

;巴特勒的餐厅在 TripAdvisor 上发布了这家不存在的餐厅的列表，并鼓励朋友和家人去参观后，受到了关注。留下正面评价。

;

;六个月内，The Shed at Dulwich 被评为伦敦最好的餐厅，而 Butler 却被预订请求淹没。

;

;在连续几个月拒绝预订后，巴特勒决定实际做一顿饭，并在食材上花了 31 英镑（40 美元）。当晚宴客人到达棚屋（实质上是巴特勒的后花园）时，他和一群朋友提供了现成的饭菜和罐头汤。

;

;巴特勒发表后 ;关于 Vice 上的经历的故事;，他接受了来自世界各地的媒体采访世界，并写了一本畅销书《如何通过胡言乱语达到第一名》。他们离开时认为，仅仅根据 TripAdvisor 的评分，这家餐厅确实可能是伦敦最好的餐厅。”巴特勒在他的文章中这样总结道。

;

;“你可以愤世嫉俗地看待这一点 - 认为餐厅的气味如今互联网是如此强大，以至于人们不再能够正确地使用他们的感官。但我喜欢积极乐观。如果我能把我的花园改造成伦敦最好的餐厅，那么一切皆有可能。”

;

;甚至，看起来，六年后又重复了这个计划。

; Wed, 27 Sep 2023 01:52:02 +0800 Everton owner received £400m from Alisher Usmanov companies, documents suggesthttps://www.theguardian.com/business/2023/sep/26/everton-fc-owner-alisher-usmanov-farhad-moshiri
;;2023-09-26T16:46:23Z;
;
;;两张单独的照片中的 Farhad Moshiri 和 Alisher Usmanov
;

;埃弗顿足球俱乐部老板 Farhad Moshiri文件显示，在俄罗斯亿万富翁阿利舍尔·乌斯马诺夫 (Alisher Usmanov) 受到制裁之前，他从阿利舍尔·乌斯马诺夫 (Alisher Usmanov) 公司收到了超过 4 亿英镑，这引发了人们对这两个人之间财务关系的新质疑。

;

; 《卫报》似乎显示，Moshiri 从 2020 年左右开始从俄罗斯-乌兹别克斯坦大亨全资拥有的一家公司借了 1.45 亿英镑。

;

;这些文件还列出了 Moshiri 在 2018 年至 2022 年间如何出售了约 2.7 亿英镑的股票最大股东是乌斯马诺夫的公司。公共账户暗示，莫希里没有支付这些股票的费用，会计专家认为这可能意味着股票销售是一份礼物。

;

;乌斯马诺夫是世界上最富有的人之一，据说;接近弗拉基米尔·普京;。他与莫希里有着长期的业务联系，两人共同拥有阿森纳足球俱乐部的股份。莫希里 ;出售了他的阿森纳; 于 2016 年将股份返还给乌斯马诺夫，以资助他对埃弗顿的初始投资。

;

;之前未报告的财务记录的发现引发了关于乌斯马诺夫之间关系的新问题。男人 - 以及莫希里的真正财富，就在这位英国商人披露临时;将埃弗顿出售给美国投资公司 777 Partners 的交易;。

;

;这些文件似乎也与 Moshiri 之前关于他如何继续;亲自为英超俱乐部提供资金;，以及他承诺提供持续的财务支持，这对于埃弗顿的审计师签字至关重要< a href="https:// /www.theguardian.com/football/2023/mar/31/evertons-survival-in-doubt-if-releated-from-the-premier-league">;今年的 2022 年账目;。

; ;

;一月份，;Moshiri 告诉 TalkSport;：“我说到做到，这是业主能做的最大事情。”

;

;在收到内部文件中列出的信息后，一位发言人乌斯马诺夫拒绝讨论融资的具体细节，但表示：“莫希里先生和他的公司确实欠乌斯马诺夫先生和与他有关联的实体。我们希望在莫希里先生完成埃弗顿俱乐部的出售后，这笔债务能够得到偿还，目前媒体正在积极宣布这一消息。”

;

;目前尚不清楚如何偿还这笔款项，因为乌斯马诺夫已;受到英国政府制裁<自 2022 年 3 月俄罗斯入侵乌克兰以来，他一直认为此举“不公平且不合理”。未经政府许可，英国公民不得将资金转移给受到制裁的个人。

;

;这位俄罗斯亿万富翁已经;自 2021 年 9 月起就被禁止进入英国;，据报道，当时足协“向阿利舍尔明确表示”乌斯马诺夫表示，他不会被允许向埃弗顿或任何其他足球俱乐部借钱。

;

;然而，《卫报》看到的文件列出了莫什里欠乌斯马诺夫公司的一系列债务，这引发了人们的疑问：莫什里是否将其中任何资金投资于埃弗顿。

;

;这位俄罗斯大亨之前未公开的与莫希里的财务联系也引发了人们对这位前会计师转型英超老板的财富的进一步质疑，其财富估计为 1.6 英镑bn。

;

;文件显示 Windfel Properties（乌斯马诺夫拥有的一家公司）借出大约在 2020 年至 2022 年 3 月期间，Moshiri 借了 7000 万英镑。文件概述，在此期间，Moshiri 旗下的一家公司似乎还从 Windfel 又借了 7500 万英镑。

;
;

;;相关：< /span>;;财政部据《卫报》了解，制裁警察正在“审查”埃弗顿足球俱乐部老板的财务;

;
;

;此外，莫希里似乎还通过出售乌斯马诺夫创建的企业集团 USM 的股份获得了约 2.7 亿英镑根据内部记录，俄罗斯人是最大的单一股东，拥有 49% 的股份。

;

;尽管在塞浦路斯提交的公开文件表明莫希里从未支付过这些股份的费用，但这笔意外之财还是到来了。 .

;

;这位英国人被列为拥有 USM 10% 的股份，但该公司自己的账目似乎规定，为了采取收购该股份的“选择权”，Moshiri 需要支付2 亿美元（1.6 亿英镑）。

;

;内部文件记录了如何在 2022 年 3 月之前支付 2 亿美元的“延期付款”以收购股票。《卫报》还可以透露，未偿债务已从最初的 780 美元削减了。 2016 年，USM 减记了 4.9 亿美元。会计专家表示，这引发了人们对 Moshiri 是否实际上被赠与了数亿美元的疑问。

;

;根据内部记录，埃弗顿所有者欠 USM 的债务由于这位英国商人没有承担 USM 约 9000 万美元的股息，尽管他似乎没有购买该公司的股份，但他并没有购买该公司的股份，这进一步减少了这一损失。

;

;在一系列以英镑和美元进行的交易中根据内部文件，Moshiri 随后在 2018 年至 2022 年间以约 2.7 亿英镑的价格出售了部分 USM 股票——似乎又返还给了公司。财务记录中的最终出售日期为 2022 年 2 月。Moshiri 的律师表示，他继续持有 USM 5% 的股份，并且他对此的兴趣从来都不是“选择”。

;

;

;这些问题《卫报》最近报道了一系列足球经理如何声称他们是;在乌斯马诺夫在场的情况下接受埃弗顿主帅职位面试;；以及前主教练卡洛·安切洛蒂如何持有;与俄罗斯人讨论;关于一系列取决于埃弗顿在英超联赛中表现的激励付款。

;在承认自己参与俱乐部的同时，乌斯马诺夫一直坚称他没有直接拥有任何股份或间接持有埃弗顿股份，并且莫希里在俱乐部做出了所有决定。他还一贯表示，他遵守英超规则，没有违反任何法律。

;

;莫希里一直表示，他将自己的钱投入英超俱乐部，并且他没有歪曲自己的身份或关系。

;

;据;俱乐部分析;账户由粉丝网站 TheEsk.org 进行。据说莫希里总共向埃弗顿投资了 7.5 亿英镑。

;

;然而，自从俱乐部被迫 ;在俄罗斯入侵乌克兰后与乌斯马诺夫保持距离;。战前，乌斯马诺夫的公司一直是埃弗顿的主要赞助商，;做出了贡献; 自 2017 年以来，俱乐部金库估计有 1.14 亿英镑。上个月，;MSP Sports Capital 拟议的投资交易;失败了。

;

;今年早些时候，《星期日泰晤士报》富豪榜估计Moshiri 的身价约为 16 亿英镑。除了埃弗顿之外，莫希里还被列为价值超过 1 亿英镑的英国财产的所有者，其中包括 ;利物浦皇家肝脏大厦;和一系列;伦敦北部的豪华住宅;，由马恩岛公司的投资组合拥有。根据土地登记文件，乌斯马诺夫在伦敦至少有一栋房屋“不是为了钱”而送给莫什里的。

;

;莫什里的律师没有回答有关莫什里从乌斯马诺夫那里收到多少钱的问题。

;

;她说：“作为埃弗顿足球俱乐部的所有者，法哈德·莫希里始终以俱乐部及其支持者的最佳利益为出发点。他不受阿利舍尔·乌斯马诺夫（或其他任何人）控制或代表其行事。这些虚假说法已被独立调查驳斥。”

;

;Spanish prosecutors have charged Shakira with failing to pay €6.7m (£5.8m) in tax on her 2018 income, authorities have said, in the country's latest fiscal allegations against the Colombian singer.

;

;Shakira is alleged to have used an offshore company based in a tax haven to avoid paying the tax, Barcelona prosecutors said in a statement.

;

;She has been notified of the charges in Miami, where she lives, according to the statement.

;

; Shakira is already due to be tried in Barcelona on 20 November in a separate case that hinges on where she lived between 2012-14. In that case, ;prosecutors allege she failed to pay €14.5m in tax.;

;

;Prosecutors in Barcelona have alleged the Grammy winner spent more than half of the 2012-14 period in Spain and therefore should have paid taxes in the country, even though her official residence was in the Bahamas.

;

;;Spanish tax officials opened the latest case against her in July.; After reviewing the evidence gathered over the last two months, prosecutors have decided to bring charges. No date for a trial was set.

;

;Shakira, whose full name is Shakira Isabel Mebarak Ripoll, has been linked to Spain since she started dating the now-retired soccer player Gerard Piqué. The couple, who have two children, lived together in Barcelona until last year, ;when they ended their 11-year relationship.;

;

;Spain tax authorities have over the past decade cracked down on footballers including Lionel Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo for not paying their full due in taxes. Those players were found guilty of tax evasion but avoided prison time thanks to a provision that allows a judge to waive sentences under two years in length for first-time offenders.

; Tue, 26 Sep 2023 23:52:01 +0800 Robert F Kennedy Jr expresses skepticism at official 9/11 accounthttps://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2023/sep/26/robert-kennedy-jr-september-11-podcast-peter-bergen
;;2023-09-26T14:00:30Z;
;
;;Robert F Kenedy Jr speaking into a microphone.
;

;In a podcast interview, the US presidential hopeful Robert F Kennedy Jr raised a conspiracy theory about 9/11 and also refused to say that al-Qaida was responsible for the attacks on New York and Washington DC.

;

;“I don't always accept official explanations,” he said.

;
;

;;Related: ;;Vivek Ramaswamy condemned for 9/11 and Jan 6 conspiracy theory remarks;

;
;

;Kennedy, 69 and an attorney, is the son of the former US attorney general and New York senator Robert F Kennedy and nephew of President John F Kennedy.

;

;Challenging Joe Biden for the Democratic nomination next year, Kennedy ;lags in polling; but has nonetheless achieved an unusual level of coverage for an outsider running against an incumbent, in part due to his family history and prominence as an anti-vaccine campaigner.

;

;Kennedy's podcast interview was with Peter Bergen, host of ;In the Room; and author of books including The Rise and Fall of Osama bin Laden and Manhunt: The Ten-Year Search for Bin Laden from 9/11 to Abbottabad.

;

;Bergen first asked if Kennedy “bought” the official explanation of 9/11, as established by the bipartisan ;9/11 commission;, which concluded that al-Qaida was responsible for the attacks of 11 September 2001, in which planes were flown into the World Trade Center and the Pentagon, while another airliner crashed in Pennsylvania. The attacks led to an immediate death toll of 2,977 (and ;thousands of related deaths; since) and stoked more than two decades of war.

;

;Kennedy said: “I don't know what happened on 9/11.我的意思是，我理解 [9/11] 的官方解释是什么，我知道存在异议。我还没有研究过。我还没有检查过。 I'm not a good person to talk to about it.”

;

;Bergen said: “So there's doubt in your mind that al-Qaida was responsible?”

;

;Kennedy raised ;a well-known 9/11 conspiracy theory;, that 7 World Trade Center, a building close to the twin towers, did not fall because of the attack nearby.

;

;He said: “Well, I know … there's strange things that happened, that don't seem … One of the buildings [in New York] came down that wasn't hit by a plane, so, you know, was it building seven or building 10?”

;

;Bergen said: “That collapsed because two of the world's biggest buildings collapsed on top of it.”

;

;Before entering the political scene, Kennedy was an environmental attorney who worked on cleaning the Hudson River.

;

;He said: “No, they didn't collapse on top of it.我的办公室就在那儿（曼哈顿的尽头）。 My offices were closed and you know … there's pictures of it collapsing. There's nothing collapsing on top of it.

;

;“I mean, listen, I don't want to argue any theories about this because all I've heard is questions.我没有解释。我对此一无所知。 But … what you're repeating now, I know not to be true.”

;

;Commenting after the interview, Bergen said: “To clarify … the government's ;official report; found that building seven was hit with debris from the north tower [of the World Trade Center].这次撞击引发了火灾，导致建筑物倒塌。 It's very well documented and there's nothing 'strange' about it.”

;

;Kennedy continued: “It's not something that I, you know, any part of [it] I endorse one way or the other, but I do think that it ought to be permissible in this country to question official narratives.”

;

;Bergen said: “I couldn't agree with you more … I've spent three decades reporting on al-Qaida, interviewed Bin Laden and, you know, spent a lot of my life … going around the world reporting on this.”

;

;Kennedy said he admired Bergen for it.

;

;Bergen continued: “But just on the ;9/11 investigation;, you know, this was the largest criminal investigation in history.有 500,000 条线索，170,000 名目击者访谈。 You're not accepting that that kind of was a – ”

;

;Kennedy said: “Don't tell me what I'm accepting or not … because I never said I don't accept that.”

;

;Bergen said: “OK, but what are you saying?”

;

;Kennedy said: “I'm saying I have no expertise in it.”

;

;Bergen said: “But you still have questions about it?”

;

;Kennedy said: “Well … I haven't read the data myself. And unfortunately for me, Peter, because it's made my life kind of difficult … I don't always accept official explanations.”

;

;Commenting on the exchange, Bergen acknowledged “conspiracy theories out there surrounding 9/11” such as those concerning building seven at the World Trade Center.

;

;“But it's an area where I have looked at the evidence and interviewed many hundreds of people myself,” Bergen said. “And if your position is that the 9/11 commission's explanation of September 11 … is somehow up for question, this kind of extreme skepticism is going to make being president, well, kinda tough.”

; Tue, 26 Sep 2023 23:22:01 +0800 JP Morgan settles Jeffrey Epstein lawsuits with US Virgin Islands for $75mhttps://www.theguardian.com/business/2023/sep/26/jpmorgan-jeffrey-epstein-lawsuit-settlement-us-virgin-islands
;;2023-09-26T14:33:32Z;
;
;;Epstein had been a JPMorgan client from 1998 until 2013, when the bank terminated their relationship.
;

;JPMorgan Chase reached settlements with the US Virgin Islands (USVI) and former executive Jes Staley to resolve lawsuits over sex trafficking by the disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein, largely resolving a scandal that has weighed on the largest US bank for months.

;

;The settlements conclude the final pieces of litigation in a saga involving women who said Epstein sexually abused them, and which embroiled some of the world's most powerful figures in finance and business.

;

;JP Morgan said its $75m settlement with the USVI includes $30m to support charitable organizations, $25m to strengthen law enforcement to combat human trafficking, and $20m for attorney's fees.

;

;Terms of the bank's settlement with Staley are confidential.

;

;In June, JP Morgan agreed to pay $290m to resolve claims by dozens of Epstein's accusers.

;

;Epstein had been a JP Morgan client from 1998 until 2013, when the bank terminated their relationship.

;

;“While the settlement does not involve admissions of liability, the firm deeply regrets any association with this man, and would never have continued doing business with him if it believed he was using the bank in any way to commit his heinous crimes,” JPMorgan said.

;

;A trial had been scheduled for 23 October.

;

;Epstein died in August 2019 in a Manhattan jail cell while awaiting trial for sex trafficking. New York City's medical examiner called his death a suicide.

;

;In July, USVI said it wanted JP Morgan to pay at least $190m, including a $150m civil fine, and possibly much more to resolve the lawsuit.

;

;USVI said JP Morgan kept Epstein as a valued client even after his 2006 arrest on prostitution charges and related guilty plea two years later, and said some bank officials stayed in touch with him long after he was dismissed.

;

;Both lawsuits exposed deficiencies in JP Morgan's oversight of clients, including many communications where employees urged the bank to stop doing business with Epstein.

;

;Tuesday's settlement resolves a rare public relations problem for Jamie Dimon, who has been JP Morgan's CEO since 2006.

;

;Dimon testified under oath in May that he had barely heard of Epstein until the financier's July 2019 arrest.

;

;JP Morgan had argued that the USVI was also to blame for enabling Epstein's sex trafficking by giving him tax incentives and waiving monitoring requirements, in exchange for cash and gifts to local officials including a former first lady.

;

;Epstein had owned two private islands within the territory, including one he allegedly bought to keep onlookers from spying on his misconduct on the other.

;

;Last November, USVI reached a settlement of at least $105m with Epstein's estate.

;

;Deutsche Bank, where Epstein was a client from 2013 to 2018, in May reached a $75m settlement with women who said Epstein sexually abused them.

; Tue, 26 Sep 2023 22:52:01 +0800 ‘No one knew anything’: rail passenger’s 11-hour London to Edinburgh odysseyhttps://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2023/sep/26/no-one-knew-anything-rail-passengers-11-hour-london-to-edinburgh-odyssey
;;2023-09-26T13:05:35Z;
;
;;An Avanti West Coast train
;

;There are many ways to cope with a rail journey from hell.有些人会袭击船上的商店购买小瓶装葡萄酒；其他人则在苦难中建立了新的友谊。 The really unlucky ones end up ;urinating in empty Pringles pots;, or climbing over 2-metre high fences (;complete with spikes;) when they arrive so late that the station has been closed.

;

;But when the comedian James Nokise found himself on an 11-hour odyssey between London and Edinburgh on Monday night, he live-tweeted the misery.

;

;Twitter may have gone out of fashion since Musk's meddling, but it remains the perfect medium for a short story full of intrigue that takes in 11th-hour cancellations, hundreds of passengers competing for taxis, and a directionally challenged cab driver jacked up on Red Bull apparently driving from Preston to Edinburgh for the first time.

;

;Nokise took the 4.40pm Avanti West Coast service from London Euston to Edinburgh, expecting to arrive at 22.21.一切都很顺利，直到 Pendolino 快要接近普雷斯顿时，Nokise 收到一封电子邮件，告诉他他乘坐的火车已被取消。 And so began his masterclass in social media storytelling.

; ; ; ;

;The human contents of the train were disgorged on to the platform at Preston and told to wait for a train to Glasgow, which would at least get Nokise to the right country, if not the right city.

;

;Alas. “原来火车已经满员了，所以当我们到达时，它就开走了。 It was around 8pm, and we were told to wait for the next train … at 9:42,” Nokise wrote.

;

;He went in search of refreshments.

; ;

;More bad news awaited.

; ; ;

;He then invited his readers to estimate the cost to Avanti West Coast of this carnival of taxis.铁路公司还没有收到账单，所以我们只能猜测最终的费用。 But with a journey from Preston to Glasgow or Edinburgh costing at least £277, according to online quotes, the bill for even 75 cabs would top £20,000.

;

;Nokise ended up sharing a taxi with three other men, who tried and failed to persuade the driver to “drop us at our locations, since he was getting a flat rate and he was not in fact a train, bound by rail lines”.

;

;The driver refused, but soon stopped to buy two cans of Red Bull “to be safe”. One of the passengers treated himself to a late-night ice-cream.

;

;They were halfway there when each passenger received an email notifying them that they were entitled to a full refund.

; ;

;It was 3.20am when he finally arrived at Edinburgh Waverley.

;

;A class of 50 schoolchildren plus teachers from Greenfaulds high school in Cumbernauld, near Glasgow, also found themselves stranded at Preston station on Monday because of the same fault with the track.

;

;Their teachers used Twitter, or X as it is now known, to appeal for help, saying they couldn't put groups of 12-year-olds on their own in taxis. “A staff member has said we are effectively stuck here,” ;they tweeted Avanti;.

;

;They ultimately managed to get back to Cumbernauld at 2.30am after sourcing their own coach and buying ;60 portions of chips; in Preston to keep the children going while they waited.

;

;An Avanti West Coast spokesperson said: “We apologise to our customers who were caught up in last night's disruption. The closure of the west coast mainline for over three hours due to a track defect had a significant impact on our services, with trains and train crew unable to work our planned timetable, resulting in cancellations of services north of Preston.

;

;“Whilst alternative transport and overnight accommodation was sourced for most of those impacted, we fully understand the frustrations of those customers whose journeys were affected, and we are extremely sorry for this.

;

;“Anyone who was affected by last night's disruption will be entitled to compensation and are urged to get in contact through our normal channels to process their claim.”
